SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 21st JUNE, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
There is no change in the general situation.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
3rd Army. In the South the Italian line now runs CAPO SILE - CAPO D'ARGINE (exclusive) - FOSSALTA (inclusive)-RONCHE. At 8 p.m. on the 19th the Austrians attacked with 4 Divisions astride the ODERZO - TREVISO Road. They gained some ground, but an Italian counter-attack at 2 a.m. on the 20th, was reported to be making steady progress in this area.
8th Army. In the region of the MO?TELLO the Italians continued their counter-attack up to midnight 19th/20th of June, and at that time appear to have reached a line running approximately as follows :- NERVESA (partially recaptured by Italians) - South of COLESEL DELLE ZORLE - ANGELI - C. SERENA. This counter-attack was resumed at 5 a.m. on the 20th.
Photographs taken on the afternoon of the 19th shew that all bridges from ZENSON to VIDOR have been destroyed. South of ZENSON 5 pontoon bridges and 2 foot-bridges appear to be intact.
For the personal information - of the Minister only. -
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
21st June, 1918.
Issued at 12.35 p.m.
